channel.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
channel.description:
^^^ just asking,cause I heard about something like [code]find.pixel[/code] ,and I thought that it may be used to write a bot?
Sorry,just realised I mistyped would you ......in runescape. I meant it to be java

item.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

Cheese_Police:

Most color clickers made in Java have to use Robot, which means using a nested for loop to go through each pixel on screen and test its color. A bit slower than desirable, but it works

haha…that’s hardcore brute-forcing

Read full topic
item.source: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?

item.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

the one:

…I thought all code was readable instantly by the JVM?

nope, Java code is readable by the compiler, which after checking syntax, converts it to .class, which includes bytecode, which is what is readable by the JVM

Read full topic

item.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“the one, post:21, topic:12574”]Ahem,your thread?Anyway,thanks for all of those who helped me with understanding beanshell.
So,just to confirm,beanshell is a scripting language based on java?[/quote]

Oh crap. I said my thread. changes

But yes, beanshell (or “bsh”) is an interpreter for a Java based scripting language.

item.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

ibot is in java. also uses awt.robot to grab the image, we are working on a alternative that involves using jni from the direct.

latest private snapshot ibot
http://www.impsoft.net/public/ibotpreview.JPG
also some here:
http://www.impsoft.net/public/ibot/pictures/standalone/

proof of alternative method of getting screen:
windows code, applet is off screen. this is by cruel: uses ubi for mouse clicks.
http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-7553971939210709298&q=queerscape&hl=en

some methods:
http://www.impsoft.net/public/ibot/javadocs/java/com/impsoft/ibot/coreMethods.html
http://www.impsoft.net/public/ibot/javadocs/java/com/impsoft/ibot/Methods.html

Read full topic

item.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
item.dc:creator: @the_one1 the one
item.description:
@the_one1 wrote:

An interperter?Of what?I thought all code was readable instantly by the JVM?Could anyone explain slightly more in-depth please?

EDIT:I think I got it.Does it mean you can type incomplete text,and beanshell causes JVM to take the information in and compile it?
Meaning does it work like

import static java.lang.System.out;

Read full topic
item.source: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?

item.title: Would you be able to write a (crappy) version of scar in java?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

lawl: The easiest way I can think of going about doing it is having the method static. So then in the eval statement you can just put

bsh.eval("UberClass.staticMethod(9999, 10);");

Another way you could do it is create a static instance of the class, and then access the instance through beanshell.
So

static final UberClass _inst = this; bsh.eval("UberClass._inst.doNonStaticMethod(); UberClass._inst.nonStaticInt = 10;");

Easiest ways of doing it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

the one: Feel free to dig through that and try to learn whatever you can from it.

I wouldn’t suggest autoing with it at all. You will need a fair amount of knowledge with AWT/Robot in order to use it.

It was a mere example
